doc:
Larry Gates https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Gates 0 Larry Gates (September 24, 1915 – December 12, 1996) was an American actor. His notable roles include H.B. Lewis on daytime's Guiding Light and Doc Baugh in the film version of Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1958). He played the role of Lewis from 1983 to 1996 and won the Emmy for Outstanding Supporting Actor at the 1985 awards. (He had previously played the role of District Attorney Eric Van Gelder on Guiding Light in 1977 and 1978.) Gates is also remembered for his role in the film version of In the Heat of the Night (1967), where his character is part of a crucial scene involving a slap. Larry_Gates ( September_24_,_1915 – December_12_,_1996 ) was an_American_actor . His_notable_roles include H.B._Lewis on daytime 's_Guiding_Light and Doc_Baugh in the_film_version of Cat on a_Hot_Tin_Roof ( 1958_) . He played the_role of Lewis from 1983 to 1996 and won the_Emmy for Outstanding_Supporting_Actor at the_1985_awards . ( He had_previously_played the_role of District_Attorney_Eric_Van_Gelder on Guiding_Light in 1977_and_1978 . ) Gates is_also_remembered for his_role in the_film_version of_In the_Heat of the_Night_(_1967_) , where his_character is part of a_crucial_scene involving a_slap .
